METHOD AND APPARATUS FOR PLAYBACK OF A HIGHER-ORDER AMBISONICS AUDIO SIGNAL
column13: An advantage of Ambisonics representation is that the reproduction of the sound field can be adapted individually to nearly any given loudspeaker position arrangement. The invention allows systematic adaptation of the playback of spatial sound field-oriented audio to its linked visible objects, by applying space warping processing as disclosed in EP 11305845.7. The reference size (or the viewing angle from a reference listening position) of the screen used in the content production is encoded and transmitted as metadata together with the content, or the decoder knows the actual size of the target screen with respect to a fixed reference screen size. The decoder warps the sound field in such a manner that all sound objects in the direction of the screen are compressed or stretched according to the ratio of the size of the target screen and the size of the reference screen.
column32: Hollerweger, Introduction to Higher Order Ambisonics, 2008

column12: METHOD AND APPARATUS FOR PLAYBACK OF A HIGHER-ORDER AMBISONICS AUDIO SIGNAL
column13: A method for generating loudspeaker signals associated with a target screen size is disclosed. The method includes receiving a bit stream containing encoded higher order ambisonics signals, the encoded higher order ambisonics signals describing a sound field associated with a production screen size. The method further includes decoding the encoded higher order ambisonics signals to obtain a first set of decoded higher order ambisonics signals representing dominant components of the sound field and a second set of decoded higher order ambisonics signals representing ambient components of the sound field. The method also includes combining the first set of decoded higher order ambisonics signals and the second set of decoded higher order ambisonics signals to produce a combined set of decoded higher order ambisonics signals.

A lock ring 52 may be retained within interior portion of the extension.

column12: Dental prosthetic arrangement and dental prosthetic system

column12: Method and apparatus for generating or cutting or changing a frame based bit stream format file including at least one header section, and a corresponding data structure
column13: In frame-based bit stream formats the data required for decoding a current frame are usually stored within the data section for that frame. One exception is the mp3 bit stream where data for a current frame is stored in previous frames. If the decoder did not receive the required previous frame, decoding of the current mp3 frame is skipped. The invention can be applied for such bit streams, in an archival mode, a streaming mode and a sample-exact cutting of an archival mode. In the streaming and cutting modes, new headers are established. The number of frames required for initialising the decoder status is signalised in the header, as well as a consistency check value in the streaming mode. These frames are used for decoder initialisation but not for decoding samples or coefficients. For a sample-exact cutting, for the frame at which the cut shall occur, the number of samples or coefficients to be muted is also indicated in the header. The invention can be applied for the hd3 audio file format for lossless extension of an mp3 bit stream.

column12: Reinforced mounting for brake servo - has clamping frames each end of servo and coupled to mounting frame
column13: A reinforced mounting for a brake servo has simple clamping frames each end of the servo housing and linked to the mounting bracket by tensile bolts along the sides of the servo housing. The frames prevent distortion of the housing during braking. The frames have circular outer sections gripped by the bolts and inner rings over the hub of the servo, linked to the outer frames by radial arms. The frames allow a light construction servo housing for weight saving. The frames and tensile bolts are selected to suit the particular bulkhead mounting.

Scheibenbremse und Verfahren zum Austauschen eines Reibbelagträgers
column13: Scheibenbremse für einen Azimutantrieb einer Gondel einer Windkraftanlage und Verfahren zum Austauschen eines Reibbelagträgers der Scheibenbremse. Eine derartige Scheibenbremse mit einem Bremsengehäuse, mit wenigstens einem hydraulisch hubbeweglichen Bremskolben, sowie mit wenigstens einem durch den Bremskolben beaufschlagbaren Reibbelagträger, der in dem Bremsengehäuse randseitig klemmend gehalten ist, ist bekannt. Erfindungsgemäß ist dem Reibbelagträger eine Demontageeinrichtung zugeordnet, die eine Hubanordnung aufweist, die sich für einen Demontagevorgang axial am Bremskolben einerseits und am Reibbelagträger andererseits abstützt und auf den Reibbelagträger eine Hubkraft ausübt, die eine Klemmkraft des Reibbelagträgers im Bremsengehäuse übersteigt. Einsatz bei Windkraftanlagen.

column12: Method and Apparatus for playback of a Higher-Order Ambisonics audio signal
column13: An advantage of Ambisonics representation is that the reproduction of the sound field can be adapted individually to nearly any given loudspeaker position arrangement. While facilitating a flexible and universal representation of spatial audio largely independent from loudspeaker setups, the combination with video playback on differently-sized screens may become distracting because the spatial sound playback is not adapted accordingly. The invention allows systematic adaptation of the playback of spatial sound field-oriented audio to its linked visible objects, by applying space warping processing as disclosed in EP 11305845.7. The reference size (or the viewing angle from a reference listening position) of the screen used in the content production is encoded and transmitted as metadata together with the content, or the decoder knows the actual size of the target screen with respect to a fixed reference screen size. The decoder warps the sound field in such a manner that all sound objects in the direction of the screen are compressed or stretched according to the ratio of the size of the target screen and the size of the reference screen.

column12: Photosensitive electronic component for colour sensor
column13: The component consists of at least one barrier contact with adjacent radiation absorption naturally conductive layer, such as n-i on b-i-junctions or metal-i structures, or double Schottky junctions. Each active layer is orthogonal to the light propagation direction. For different, externally applied voltage the charge carriers, generated by different, spectral radiation, are collected. In the advanced part-layer, in the light impingement direction, is available a higher collected length for photogenerated charge carriers then in the following part-layer. The two part-layers have different electric field strengths such that in the advanced part-layer short wave charge carriers are collected and in the following part-layer long-wave charge carriers are collected.

column12: METHOD AND APPARATUS FOR PLAYBACK OF A HIGHER-ORDER AMBISONICS AUDIO SIGNAL
column13: An advantage of Ambisonics representation is that the reproduction of the sound field can be adapted individually to nearly any given loudspeaker position arrangement. While facilitating a representation of spatial audio independent from loudspeaker set-ups, the combination with video reproduction on differently-sized screens may become distracting because the spatial sound reproduction is not adapted accordingly. The invention allows systematic adaptation of the reproduction of spatial sound field-oriented audio to its linked visible objects, by applying space warping processing as disclosed in EP 11305845.7. The reference size (or the viewing angle from a reference listening position) of the screen used in the content production is encoded and transmitted as metadata together with the content, or the decoder knows the actual size of the target screen with respect to a fixed reference screen size. column12: Method and apparatus for comparing received candidate sound or video items with multiple candidate reference sound or video items
column13: If there are a number of candidate sound items, which are derived from a candidate reference sound item and which are received together with noise, it is very difficult to automatically identify correctly from which reference sound item the received candidate sound item was derived. Correlation is used for comparing received sound items with candidate reference sound items. A measure value for the similarity of each pair of sound items is formed from the correlation, which measure value is high if the correlation is low. If this measure value is below a threshold, both sound items are determined as matching. Otherwise this measure value is stored together with a reference to the candidate reference sound item in a list. If a given number of list entries is reached and if the lowest measure value in the list is less than the second lowest measure value when divided by a predetermined factor greater '1', then the lowest measure value is determined as being a matching sound item.

Reference size of a screen used in content production or a viewing angle from a reference listening position is encoded and transmitted as metadata together with content. column12: Pipette for a pipette system with pipette and syringe
column13: Gegenstand der Erfindung ist eine Pipette für ein Pipettensystem aus einer Pipette (1) und einer Spritze (2). Im Pipettengehäuse (3) der Pipette befindet sich eine Kolbenstelleinrichtung (4) mit einer axial verschiebbaren Zahnstange (7) mit einer Verzahnung (7.1). Die Zahnstange (7) ist mit dem Kolbenkopf (2.3) einer eingesetzten Spritze (2) gekuppelt. Erfindungsgemäß ist die Zahnstange (7) mehrteilig ausgeführt und besteht zumindest aus einem Träger (7.2) und einem Verzahnungsteil (7.3). Der Träger (7.2) weist eine Aufnahme für das Verzahnungsteil (7.3) auf und das Verzahnungsteil (7.3) seinerseits trägt die Verzahnung (7.1). Aufgrund dieser Zweiteiligkeit der Zahnstange (7) kann man den Träger (7.2) einerseits und das Verzahnungsteil (7.3) andererseits aus unterschiedlichen Materialien ausführen, die den jeweiligen speziellen Anforderungen angepasst sind.

column12: Group antenna for multiple transmit and receive modes - has input stages providing conversion to optical form for handling over optical fibre antenna network
column13: A group antenna, consisting of a number of receiving elements, provides an improved feedback of signal to the processing circuit. The individual stages consist of transmit/receive modules (TR), each with an optical conductor connected to a star coupler. A laser provides an input to the optical network coupled to the individual antenna star couplers. The signals are converted to electrical form for transmission. Received signals are modulated for transmission through the optical lines. ADVANTAGE - Improved return of received signals from separate antenna elements to signal processing stages.

column12: Method and apparatus for playback of a higher-order ambisonics audio signal
column13: The invention relates to a method and apparatus for playback of a higher-order ambisonics audio signal. The invention systematically adapts the playback of spatial sound field-oriented audio to its linked visible objects, by applying space warping processing disclosed in EP 11305845.7. The reference size (or the viewing angle from a reference listening position) of the screen used in the content production is encoded and transmitted as meta-data, or the decoder knows the size of the target screen with respect to a reference screen size. The decoder warps the sound field such that all sound objects in the direction of the screen are compressed or stretched according to the ratio of the sizes of the target and reference screens.

column12: Simulating quenching of e.g. inductively-heated automobile crankshafts, simplifies open boundary value problem for fluid simulation, into boundary value problem with invariant surfaces
column13: An open boundary value problem for fluid simulation is converted by use of artificial edge-closure, into a boundary value problem with invariant surfaces. The artificial edge-closure has cylindrical form.

column12: Laser writable multi layer sheet.
column13: Die Erfindung betrifft eine Mehrschichtfolie, die eine farbige Gestaltung von Schrift- und Bildzeichen mittels Laserstrahl ermöglicht. Derartig beschriftete Folien kommen vorzugsweise als Etiketten zum Einsatz. Aufgabe der Erfindung ist es, eine mittels Laserstrahl beschriftbare Mehrschichtfolie zu schaffen, die einen einfachen Aufbau besitzt und die Gestaltung eines Etiketts mit farbigen Schrift- und Bildzeichen gestattet. Die Erfindung löst diese Aufgabe durch eine mit einem Laserstrahl beschriftbare Mehrschichtfolie, bei der eine unter einer mittels Laserstrahl thermisch lokal abbaubaren, aus einem Aluminium-Substrat bestehenden Deckschicht (1) eine zweite, den verwendeten Laserstrahl nicht absorbierende Schicht beliebiger Einfärbung vorhanden ist.

METHOD AND DEVICE FOR PLAYBACK OF HIGHER-ORDER AMBISONICS AUDIO SIGNAL
column13: To provide a method and device for playback of a high-order ambisonics (HOA) audio signal.SOLUTION: A method includes the steps of: decoding a HOA audio signal so as to provide decoded audio signals; receiving or establishing reproduction adaptation information derived from a difference in width, height, and curvature between an original screen and a current screen; adapting the decoded audio signals by warping them in a space domain; rendering and outputting the adapted decoded audio signals for a loudspeaker. The reproduction adaptation information is used to control the warping so as to match a perceived position of at least one audio object represented by the adapted decoded audio signals with a perceived position of an associated video object on the screen for a current screen viewer and a listener of the adapted decoded audio signals.SELECTED DRAWING: None

column12: Data communication network for motor vehicle - comprises hybrid network with electrical lines between control devices and optical fibres between latter and peripherals
column13: The communication network allows data to be transformed between a number of control devices and associated peripherals. It comprises a hybrid network having an electrical line network which couples the control devices together and a number of optical fibre networks each coupling a number of peripherals with the corresponding control device. Each peripheral and control device has opto-electronic transducers for the data signals fed along the optical fibres. Pref. each optical fibre network comprises a star network with a semi-duplex operating mode. ADVANTAGE - Can be reliably installed in region subject to strong interference effects.

column12: METHOD AND APPARATUS FOR PLAYBACK OF A HIGHER-ORDER AMBISONICS AUDIO SIGNAL
column13: An advantage of ambisonics representation is that the reproduction of a sound field can be individually adapted to almost any given arrangement of loudspeaker positions. Although spatial audio is usually presented flexibly and universally easily independent of the loudspeaker setup, coupling with video playback on screens of different sizes can suffer because spatial audio reproduction is not properly adapted. The present invention systematically adapts the reproduction of spatial sound field oriented audio to associated visible objects thereof by applying a spatial warping process as disclosed in EP 11305845.7. The reference size of a screen used when creating content (or viewing angle from a reference listening position) is encoded and passed along with the content as metadata, or a decoder knows the actual size of a target screen for a fixed reference screen size. The decoder warps a sound field in such a way that all acoustic objects in the screen direction are compressed or stretched according to the ratio of the size of the target screen to the size of a reference screen.

column12: Modified ziegler catalyst, process for preparing it and process for preparing a poly-1-olefin in its presence
column13: The invention relates to a modified Ziegler catalyst for preparing a poly-1-olefin in suspension, in solution or in the gas phase, which catalyst comprises the reaction product of a magnesium alkoxide (component a) with a transition metal compound (component b) and an organometallic compound (component c) together with an additional component (d) comprising a compound of the chemical formula M-R x where M is an element of main group IV of the Periodic Table, R is an organic radical such as alkyl having from 1 to 10 carbon atoms, oxyalkyl having from 1 to 10 carbon atoms, cycloalkyl having from 4 to 8 carbon atoms in the ring and, if desired, from 1 to 6 substituents R' on the ring, aryl having from 6 to 10 carbon atoms in the aromatic and, if desired, from 1 to 6 substituents R' on the aromatic, where R' is a halogen or an alkyl radical having from 1 to 4 carbon atoms or an OH group or an NO 2 group or an oxyalkyl radical having from 1 to 4 carbon atoms, and x is an integer from 1 to 4. The invention also relates to a process for preparing the Ziegler catalyst and to the homopolymerization or copolymerization of 1-olefins in its presence.

METHOD AND APPARATUS FOR SCREEN RELATED ADAPTATION OF A HIGHER-ORDER AMBISONICS AUDIO SIGNAL
column13: A method for generating loudspeaker signals associated with a target screen size is disclosed. The method includes receiving a bit stream containing encoded higher order ambisonics signals, the encoded higher order ambisonics signals describing a sound field associated with a production screen size. The method further includes decoding the encoded higher order ambisonics signals to obtain a first set of decoded higher order ambisonics signals representing dominant components of the sound field and a second set of decoded higher order ambisonics signals representing ambient components of the sound field. The method also includes combining the first set of decoded higher order ambisonics signals and the second set of decoded higher order ambisonics signals to produce a combined set of decoded higher order ambisonics signals.

column12: METHOD AND APPARATUS FOR PLAYBACK OF A HIGHER-ORDER AMBISONICS AUDIO SIGNAL
column13: The present invention relates to a method and an apparatus for reproducing a high-order ambisonic audio signal. According to the present invention, an advantage of the ambisonic expression is that reproduction of a sound field can be almost individually applied to even to any given loudspeaker position arrangement. Generally, spatial audio is expressed to be flexible and easy for a universal use independent of loudspeaker settings but coupling with video reproduction on a screen of a different size may have the difficulty due to inappropriate adaption of spatial audio reproduction. According to the present invention, spatial warping processing is applied as disclosed in EP 11305845.7 to systematically adapt reproduction of a spatial sound field-oriented audio to a visible object associated therewith. Also, a reference size (or a viewing angle as viewed from a reference listening position) of a screen used in content production is encoded and transmitted as metadata with content, or a decoder recognizes an actual size of a target screen with respect to a fixed reference screen size. Also, the decoder warps the sound field in a manner that all audio objects in a screen direction are compressed or stretched in accordance with a size of the target screen and a size of a reference screen.

column12: Eddy current brake for non-contact torque transmission has an armature ring with a ring body for rotating around a hinge pin and cooling ribs on its outer periphery
column13: Circulated with cooling air and shaped as a single piece from the ring body of an armature ring, cooling ribs take the shape of fins and are distributed with even gaps parallel to a hinge pin (D) over the periphery of the ring body. They extend over more than half the length of the ring body. A cooling airflow can leave an eddy current brake (1) through a ventilation grid (G).

column12: METHOD AND DEVICE FOR REPRODUCING HIGH-ORDER AMBISONICS AUDIO SIGNAL
column13: To provide a method and device for reproducing a high-order Ambisonics audio signal being an original allocated to a video signal generated for a screen different from an original to be presented on the current screen.SOLUTION: A storage device 92 stores an HOA encoded signal. A signal undergoing an HOA representation from the device 92 is HOA decoded by an HOA decoder 93, for example, for presentation in a movie theater, is entered to a renderer 95 through a distortion stage 94, and is outputted as a speaker signal 91 for a set of speakers. The distortion stage 94 receives reproduction adaptive information 90 derived from height as width and possibility between current screens and difference of curvature as possibility, and uses the reproduction adaptive information to properly adapt the decoded HOA signal.SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 9

column13: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a method based on an Ambisonics representation which has an advantage that reproduction of a sound field can be adapted individually to nearly any given loudspeaker position arrangement to thereby facilitate a flexible and universal representation of spatial audio substantially independent of loudspeaker setups while combination with a video playback on differently-sized screens is not distracting for a listener because a spatial sound playback is adapted.SOLUTION: The invention allows systematic adaptation of a spatial sound field-oriented audio scene to its linked visible objects, by applying space warping processing. A decoder knows the actual size of a target screen with respect to a fixed reference screen size. The decoder warps a sound field in such a manner that all sound objects in the direction of the screen are compressed or stretched according to the ratio of the size of the target screen and the size of the reference screen.

column12: Method for measuring absolute rotations and arrangement for carrying out the method
column13: The invention relates to a method for measuring absolute rotations with the aid of an optical-fibre interferometer (fibre giro) and an arrangement for carrying out the method. The output signal of fibre giro contains interfering odd-numbered harmonics of the modulation frequency used. These odd-numbered harmonics are suppressed by analog and/or digital filters. In addition, the A/D converter characteristic is linearized by adding a triangular signal.

column12: Brake operating device for hydraulic vehicle brake system - has main brake cylinder with two pressure chambers in steel tube housings.
column13: The device consists of pneumatic brake force intensifier, pref. underpressure intensifier, and a main brake cylinder arrangement. This has two separate pressure chambers, pref. located next to each other. The intensifier has a movable wall, charged with a pneumatic differential pressure. The intensifier force of this, and an actuating force, are transmitted via an elastic reaction disc to two pistons, limiting the pressure chambers. The pressure chambers (9,10) are formed in two steel tube housings (7,8). The intersection of the effective lines of the reaction forces, resulting from the hydraulic pressure in the chambers, with the symmetrical axis (40) of the brake force intensifier (1), is located within the fastening range of the actuating rod (5) on the brake pedal (3). ADVANTAGE - Cheap, problem-free handling of reaction forces.

column12: FLUID HANDLING DEVICES
column13: A device for determining the concentration of analytes in bodily fluids, said device comprising: a controller module comprising an actuator; a fluid handling module, comprising: a skin piercing fluid collection channel comprising a needle; an inlet chamber connected to a first end of said skin piercing fluid collection channel; a pumping chamber; a connecting channel connecting said inlet chamber to an inlet end of said pumping chamber; a membrane connected to said actuator, said membrane forming at least a portion of one wall of said pumping chamber opposite said inlet end of said pumping chamber, said membrane gel being deflectable in response to movement of said actuator; a sensor chamber including a sensor for detecting said analyte; an inlet channel connecting an outlet end of said pumping chamber to an inlet end of said sensor chamber; a waste channel connected to an outlet end of said sensor chamber; and a vent connected to an outlet end of said waste channel, such that said pumping chamber is capable of transporting a volume of fluid collected in said pumping chamber from said skin piercing fluid collection channel, to said at least one sensor chamber upon deflection of said membrane.

column12: METHOD AND APPARATUS FOR PLAYBACK OF A HIGHER-ORDER AMBISONICS AUDIO SIGNAL
column13: PURPOSE: A method and apparatus for the playback of a higher-order ambisonics (HOA) audio signal are provided to facilitate the playback of spatial sound, thereby improving surround sound. CONSTITUTION: An HOA-encoded signal is stored in a storage device. The HOA-represented signal is decoded in an HOA decoder (93), delivered to a renderer (95), and then outputted as a loudspeaker signal. A warping stage (94) receives reproduction adaptation information.

column12: Method and apparatus for playback of a higher-order ambisonics audio signal
column13: An advantage of Ambisonics representation is that the reproduction of the sound field can be adapted individually to nearly any given loudspeaker position arrangement. While facilitating a representation of spatial audio independent from loudspeaker set-ups, the combination with video playback on differently-sized screens may become distracting because the spatial sound playback is not adapted accordingly. The invention allows systematic adaptation of the playback of spatial sound field-oriented audio to its linked visible objects, by applying space warping processing as disclosed in EP 11305845.7. The reference size (or the viewing angle from a reference listening position) of the screen used in the content production is encoded and transmitted as metadata together with the content, or the decoder knows the actual size of the target screen with respect to a fixed reference screen size. The decoder warps the sound field in such a manner that all sound objects in the direction of the screen are compressed or stretched according to the ratio of the size of the target screen and the size of the reference screen.

column12: TELMISARTAN AND HYDROCHLOROTHIAZIDE COMBINATION THERAPY

column12: Method and apparatus for playback of a higher-order ambisonics audio signal
column13: With Ambisonics representation, the reproduction of the sound field can be adapted to any loudspeaker position arrangement. While facilitating a representation of spatial audio independent from loudspeaker set-ups, the combination with video playback on differently-sized screens may become distracting because the spatial sound playback is not adapted accordingly. The invention adapts the playback of spatial sound field-oriented audio to its linked visible objects, by applying space warping processing. The reference size (or the viewing angle from a reference listening position) of the screen used in the content production is encoded and transmitted as meta-data, or the decoder knows the size of the target screen with respect to a reference screen size. The decoder warps the sound field such that all sound objects in the direction of the screen are compressed or stretched according to the ratio of the sizes of the target and reference screens.

column12: Processing of periodic input signals of fibre ring photodetector - sampling signal, averaging, storing, reading out at lower frequency and digitising
column13: The signal processing method involves sampling the signal at a number of discrete points within the signal period, digitising the samples and averaging over the discrete points. The sampled points are averaged in an analog manner and stored. The stored values are read out at a low readout rate compared to the sampling frequency and digitised. Several harmonics of the fundamental frequency of the periodic input signal are evaluated from the digital signal. USE/ADVANTAGE - E.g. for use with laser gyro. Does not require expensive analogue-to-digital converters or high power consumption.

column12: Process for the surface treatment of thin-film magnetic discs
column13: The invention relates to a process for the surface treatment of metallic thin-film magnetic discs, which are provided with carbon protective layers, by polishing with a strip of non-woven fabric moving along a sector of the rotating magnetic disc.

column12: OPTICAL LAYER SYSTEM HAVING ANTI-REFLECTION, WHERE LAYER PACKAGES ARE LOCATED ON BOTH SIDES OF SUBSTRATE
column13: PURPOSE: An optical layer system having anti-reflection is provided to cause uniform layer resistance in its inside with minimum number of layers. CONSTITUTION: The optical layer system includes a transparent and flat substrate(7), and the substrate has two parallel surfaces, and a layer package is formed on more than one surface. The layer package is formed on the surface of the substrate, and includes the first layer(8) whose refractive index is 1.20 - 1.37, and the second layer(9) whose refractive index is 1.40 - 1.48. The second layer is located on the first layer. The layer package exists on both sides of the substrate.

column12: Method and apparatus for screen related adaptation of a Higher-Order Ambisonics audio signal
column13: A method for generating loudspeaker signals associated with a target screen size is disclosed. The method includes receiving a bit stream containing encoded higher order ambisonics signals, the encoded higher order ambisonics signals describing a sound field associated with a production screen size. The method further includes decoding the encoded higher order ambisonics signals to obtain a first set of decoded higher order ambisonics signals representing dominant components of the sound field and a second set of decoded higher order ambisonics signals representing ambient components of the sound field. The method also includes combining the first set of decoded higher order ambisonics signals and the second set of decoded higher order ambisonics signals to produce a combined set of decoded higher order ambisonics signals.

Amorphous silicon based photosensitive electronic device
column13: The parent patent (Application No. 19637126) describes an amorphous silicon (alloy) based photosensitive electronic device having blocking contacts with adjacent radiation absorbing intrinsically conductive layers, each active layer being arranged normal to the light propagation direction. Charge carriers, generated by varied spectral radiation, are collected at different externally applied voltages. At least one of the intrinsically conductive layers consists of two sub-layers of different collection lengths (drift lengths) for photo-generated charge carriers, the leading and trailing (in the light incidence direction) sub-layers (I, II) having respectively longer and shorter collection lengths for producing different electric field strengths so that multiplied charge carriers are collected at short and long wave light irradiation, respectively. In this patent of addition, the novelty is that at least one of the intrinsically conductive layers has an additional third sub-layer (III) having a collection length (drift length) which differs from those of the other two sub-layers (I, II) so that multiplied charge carriers of different respective spectral regions are collected in each of the three sub-layers. Preferably, the device has a glass substrate bearing (a) a p-conductive (or n-conductive) a-Si:H layer; (b) an intrinsically conductive a-Si:H layer consisting of three sub-layers (I, II, III) of different dielectric constants increasing in the light incidence direction; and (c) an n-conductive (or p-conductive) a-Si:H layer.

column12: ADVANCED ANALYTE SENSOR CALIBRATION AND ERROR DETECTION
column13: Systems and methods for processing sensor data and self-calibration are provided. In some embodiments, systems and methods are provided which are capable of calibrating a continuous analyte sensor based on an initial sensitivity, and then continuously performing self-calibration without using, or with reduced use of, reference measurements. In certain embodiments, a sensitivity of the analyte sensor is determined by applying an estimative algorithm that is a function of certain parameters. Also described herein are systems and methods for determining a property of an analyte sensor using a stimulus signal. The sensor property can be used to compensate sensor data for sensitivity drift, or determine another property associated with the sensor, such as temperature, sensor membrane damage, moisture ingress in sensor electronics, and scaling factors.

High-dimensional index structure
column13: A method for transforming multi-dimensional data points into 1-dimensional values which are stored in a 1-dimensional index structure is disclosed. The data space is divided into a first plurality of pyramids each having a center point of the data space as a top and a (d-1) dimensional surface of the data space as a base, wherein the first plurality of pyramids is equal to twice the number of dimensions of the data space. Each pyramid is then divided into a second plurality of partitions. A Pyramid-value for each partition is then computed. Finally, each partition is stored in the index structure using the Pyramid-value as an index key.

column12: METHOD AND APPARATUS FOR PLAYBACK OF A HIGHER-ORDER AMBISONICS AUDIO SIGNAL
column13: The advantage of the ambisonic representation is that reproduction of a sound field can be adapted individually to almost any given loudspeaker position arrangement. Although generally flexible and universally easy to present spatial audio independent of loudspeaker setup, coupling with video playback on other sized screens may be difficult as spatial acoustics reproduction is not adequately adapted. The present invention systematically adapts reproduction of spatial sound field oriented audio to a visible object associated therewith by applying a spatial warping process as disclosed in EP 11305845.7. The reference size of a screen used in content creation (or a viewing angle from a reference listening position) is either encoded or passed along with the content as metadata, or a decoder knows the actual size of a target screen relative to a fixed reference screen size. The decoder warps the sound field in such a way that all sound objects in the screen direction are compressed or expanded according to the ratio of the size of the target screen to the size of a reference screen.

column12: HIGH-ENERGY SECONDARY BATTERY
column13: The invention concerns a high-energy secondary battery cell with a casing containing a solid electrolyte (1) consisting of a β-aluminium-oxide ceramic material which conducts ions well and which divides the inside of the cell into a positive and a negative electrode (8, 9) and is connected to the positive and negative electrodes by electrically conducting parts of the casing. The solid electrolyte (1) is connected to these two casing parts by a connecting piece (3) made of low-conducting β-aluminium-oxide ceramic material.

column12: Fluid handling devices
Scheibenbremse und Verfahren zum Austauschen eines Reibbelagträgers
column13: Scheibenbremse für einen Azimutantrieb einer Gondel einer Windkraftanlage und Verfahren zum Austauschen eines Reibbelagträgers der Scheibenbremse. Eine derartige Scheibenbremse mit einem Bremsengehäuse, mit wenigstens einem hydraulisch hubbeweglichen Bremskolben, sowie mit wenigstens einem durch den Bremskolben beaufschlagbaren Reibbelagträger, der in dem Bremsengehäuse randseitig klemmend gehalten ist, ist bekannt. Erfindungsgemäß ist dem Reibbelagträger eine Demontageeinrichtung zugeordnet, die eine Hubanordnung aufweist, die sich für einen Demontagevorgang axial am Bremskolben einerseits und am Reibbelagträger andererseits abstützt und auf den Reibbelagträger eine Hubkraft ausübt, die eine Klemmkraft des Reibbelagträgers im Bremsengehäuse übersteigt. Einsatz bei Windkraftanlagen.

column13: To provide a method in which spatial audio content expressed as coefficients of sound field decomposition is adapted to video screens of various sizes, thereby making a sound playback position of an object on a screen match a corresponding visible position.SOLUTION: Reference size of a screen used in content production or a viewing angle from a reference listening position is encoded and transmitted as metadata together with content. Or, when the decoder knows actual size of a target screen with respect to fixed reference screen size, the decoder warps a sound field in such a manner that all sound objects in a direction of the screen are compressed or stretched according to ratio of the size of the target screen and the size of the reference screen.SELECTED DRAWING: None

column12: MODIFIED ZIEGLER CATALYST, PROCESS FOR PREPARING IT AND PROCESS FOR PREPARING POLY-1-OLEFINS IN ITS PRESENCE
column13: The invention relates to a modified Ziegler catalyst for preparing a poly-1-olefin in suspension, in solution or in the gas phase, which catalyst comprises the reaction product of a magnesium alkoxide (component a) with a transition metal compound (component b) and an organometallic compound (component c) together with an additional component (d) comprising a compound of the chemical formula M - Rx where M is an element of main group IV of the Periodic Table, R is halogen or an organic radical such as alkyl having from 1 to 10 carbon atoms, oxyalkyl having from 1 to 10 carbon atoms, cycloalkyl having from 4 to 8 carbon atoms in the ring and, if desired, from 1 to 6 substituents R' on the ring, aryl having from 6 to 10 carbon atoms in the aromatic and, if desired, from 1 to 6 substituents R' on the aromatic, where R' is a halogen or an alkyl radical having from 1 to 4 carbon atoms or an OH group or an NO2 group or an oxyalkyl radical having from 1 to 4 carbon atoms, and x is an integer from 1 to 4. The invention also relates to a process for preparing the Ziegler catalyst and to the homopolymerization or copolymerization of 1-olefins in its presence.

column12: METHOD AND DEVICE FOR CONTROLLING DISTRIBUTION-TYPE BRAKE DEVICE
column13: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To improve a method and a device for controlling a distribution-type brake device for a vehicle so as not to give disadvantageous influence on an antilock function or the like. SOLUTION: In this control method and device of the distribution type brake device for the vehicle, at least one central control unit and one distribution-type control unit belonging to at least one wheel brake are mounted. In the distribution-type control unit, a means capable of early detecting the locking tendency and/or slip-rotating tendency of an attached wheel is mounted. An additional operation variable is produced from the distribution-type control unit, and the additional operation variable operates a brake adjusting device of a wheel brake, preferably a motor-driven brake adjusting device in the direction to prevent the locking or the slip rotation.

column12: METHOD AND APPARATUS FOR PLAYBACK OF A HIGHER-ORDER AMBISONICS AUDIO SIGNAL
column13: 앰비소닉 표현의 이점은 음장의 재생을 개별적으로 어떠한 주어진 라우드스피커 위치 배열에도 거의 적응시킬 수 있다는 것이다. 대체로 라우드스피커 설정과 독립적으로 공간 오디오를 융통성 있고 범용으로 용이하게 표현하지만, 다른 크기의 스크린 상에서 비디오 재생과의 결합은 공간 음향 재생이 적절히 적응되지 못하기 때문에 어려움을 겪을 수 있다. 본 발명은 EP 11305845.7에 개시된 바와 같은 공간 워핑 처리를 적용함으로써 공간 음장 지향 오디오의 재생을 그와 연관된 가시 객체에 체계적으로 적응시킨다. 콘텐츠 제작시 사용된 스크린의 기준 크기(또는 기준 청취 위치에서 본 시야각)은 인코드되어 메타데이터로서 콘텐츠와 함께 전달되거나, 또는 디코더는 고정된 기준 스크린 크기에 대해 타겟 스크린의 실제 크기를 알고 있다. 디코더는 스크린 방향의 모든 음향 객체가 타겟 스크린의 크기와 기준 스크린의 크기의 비에 따라 압축되거나 신장되는 방식으로 음장을 워핑한다.

column12: METHOD AND APPARATUS FOR PLAYBACK OF A HIGHER-ORDER AMBISONICS AUDIO SIGNAL
column13: An advantage of Ambisonics representation is that reproduction of a sound field can be adapted individually to nearly any given loudspeaker position arrangement. Generally speaking, spatial audio is flexibly, universally and easily expressed independently of loudspeaker settings, but combination with video playback on different sized screens can be difficult since spatial sound playback is not properly adapted. The present invention allows systematic adaptation of playback of spatial sound field-oriented audio to visible objects linked thereto, by applying space warping processing as disclosed in EP 11305845.7. A reference size (or a viewing angle from a reference listening position) of a screen used in content production is encoded and transmitted as metadata together with the content, or a decoder knows an actual size of a target screen with respect to a fixed reference screen size. The decoder warps the sound field in such a manner that all sound objects in the direction of the screen are compressed or stretched according to the ratio of a size of the target screen and a size of the reference screen.

column12: PHARMACEUTICAL COMBINATION OF ANGIOTENSIN II ANTAGONISTS AND ACE INHIBITORS
column13: The invention relates to a method of treatment of indications which can be positively influenced by inhibition of AT1 mediated effects with maintenance of AT2 receptor mediated effects of Angiotensin II and by ACE inhibition, thus also increasing bradykinin mediated effects, e.g. to reduce the incidence of stroke, acute myocardial infarction or cardiovascular death, or of indications associated with the increase of AT1 receptors in the sub-epithelial area or increase of AT2 receptors in the epithelia, comprising co-administration of effective amounts of an Angiotensin II antagonist and an ACE inhibitor, pharmaceutical compositions containing an Angiotensin II antagonist together with an ACE inhibitor and the use of an Angiotensin II antagonist and an ACE inhibitor for the manufacture of corresponding pharmaceutical compositions.

column12: System zum Steuern oder Regeln einer elektromechanischen Bremse
column13: In brakes operated electromechanically or by electric motors, the problem is to set a clearance, since automatic setting means of the type provided for hydraulic brakes are not suitable for this type of brake. It is first necessary to establish a neutral position for the motor, that position being defined as the position in which the friction elements are directly in contact with the brake disk. This is established by means of a detection device which in a preferred embodiment works in the following way: the motor is started from an unknown position with a constant motor moment in such a way as to impel the friction linings towards the brake disk. The motor will then accelerate since the resistances remain constant in the start stroke. When the friction linings come into contact with the brake disk, the motor is slowed sharply. The zero-passage of the angular acceleration can be detected and used an indication that the friction linings are in contact with the brake disk. A so-called contact signal is then generated and causes the motor to be run back by a specified angle in a position-adjusted way, the angle corresponding to the clearance to be set.

At least the substrate and the (first) electrode, the (second) electrode, or the substrate, the (first) and the (second) electrode are transparent. column12: CIRCUIT ASSEMBLY FOR THE STATE MONITORING AND LOGGING OF OVERVOLTAGE PROTECTION DEVICES OR OVERVOLTAGE PROTECTION SYSTEMS
column13: The invention relates to a circuit assembly for the state monitoring and logging of overvoltage protection devices or overvoltage protection systems by means of pulse current monitoring, comprising at least one passive RFID transponder having an inductively coupled voltage supply, wherein in the case of an event of the overvoltage protection device or the overvoltage protection system, the RFID transponder antenna circuit is influenced, in particular interrupted, short circuited, or detuned, so that disturbance processes can be identified. According to the invention, a coil L2 is provided on a discharge line of the overvoltage protection device or the overvoltage protection system that carries pulse currents that occur, which coil L2 is oriented in such a way that the field caused by pulse current passes through the coil winding surface, wherein the coil L2 is connected to at least one switching device, which is connected on the antenna circuit of the RFID transponder to the inductor L1 there in order to influence the antenna circuit at least at times.

column12: Quantitative determn. of guanine nucleotide binding protein - by incubating solubilised membrane compsn. with radio-iodinated homologue and polyclonal antiserum, with purified protein used as standard
column13: In the quantitative determination of guanine-nucleotide binding proteins (I;G-proteins) in which (I) are bound to membranes of cells and tissue by radioimmune reaction, the new features are (1) the radioligand used is a synthetic peptide homologous to (I) and labelled with 125-iodine, (2) a polyclonal antiserum raised in rabbits is used; (3) purified (I) is used as the standard. The membranes used are pref. completely solubilised by treating with detergent; polyclonal serum is made by immunisation with synthetic peptides or native (I). USE/ADVANTAGE - The method is quantitative; technically simple, rapid (without the ribosylation and gel- electrophoretic sepn. used in known assays); sensitive and accurate. It is useful in studying the regulation of certain cell functions (and of the way in which these are affected by hormones and pharmaceuticals)

column12: MAINTENANCE OF DATA CONNECTIONS DURING THE CHANGEOVER OF A COMMUNICATION ACCESS NETWORK
column13: The invention relates to a method for maintaining at least one data connection to a terminal (UE) during the changeover of a first communication access network (WLAN) to at least one second communication access network (PS). According to the invention, at least two private user identities and at least two IP addresses are allocated to the terminal (UE) in order to form a public user identity for the user of the terminal (UE). The terminal registers itself in an IP communication network in parallel per communication access network respectively comprising one private user identity and the common public user identity, and an IP address for the first (WLAN) and the at least one second communication access network (PS).

column12: Circuit for deactivating faulty keys in a signal box
column13: The subject matter of the invention is a circuit for deactivating individual faulty keys in a signal box. By inserting additional switching means, it is possible to continue the signal box operation with all the non-faulty keys by exploiting already existing switching means and as a result the availability of the signal box is considerably increased. The reliability of the signal box functions is completely preserved.

column12: DIODENLASERGEPUMPTER VIELMODEN-WELLENLEITERLASER, INSBESONDERE FASERLASER
column13: The invention concerns a multimode waveguide laser (1, 2, 3, 5) which is characterized by the fact that the waveguide's cutoff wavelength is smaller than the smallest wavelength of the emission spectrum of the waveguide laser. Advantageously, the waveguide laser and te diode laser (6) in the wavelength range of the waveguide laser emission are optically decoupled, thus making the diode laser pumped waveguide laser specially suitable for intra-cavity spectroscopy.

column12: POLYETHYLENE BLOW MOLDING COMPOSITION FOR PRODUCING LARGE CONTAINERS
column13: The invention relates to a polyethylene composition with multimodal molecular mass distribution, which is particularly suitable for the blow molding of large containers with a volume in the range of from 10 to 150 dm3 (I). The composition has a density in the range of from 0.949 to 0.955g/cm3 at 23 °C and an MFI190/5 in the range of from 0.1 to 0.3 dg/min. It comprises from 38 to 45 % by weight of a low-molecular-mass ethylene homopolymer A, from 30 to 40 % by weight of a high-molecular-mass copolymer B made from ethylene and from another 1-olefin having from 4 to 8 carbon atoms, and from 18 to 26 % by weight of an ultrahigh-molecular-mass ethylene copolymer C.

column12: Method and apparatus for avoiding unmasking of coding noise when mixing perceptually coded multi-channel audio signals
column13: Playback of certain multi-channel audio signal representations on a particular loudspeaker set-up requires a special rendering, which usually consists of a matrixing operation. If a particular individual loudspeaker set-up on which the matrix of the matrixing operation depends is not known at the perceptual coding stage, a noise unmasking problem occurs. According to the invention, this problem can be solved by decorrelating the individual audio channel signals before perceptual encoding and recorrelating them after the perceptual decoding.

column12: Methods and apparatus for encoding and decoding multi-channel HOA audio signals
column13: The present invention is directed to apparatus and methods for decoding Higher Order Ambisonics (HOA) audio signals. HOA audio signals may be decompressed based on perceptual decoding to determine at least an HOA representation corresponding to the HOA audio signals. A rotated transform may be determined based on a rotation of a spherical sample grid. A rotated HOA representation may be determined based on the rotated transform and the HOA representation. The rotated HOA representation may be rendered to output to a loudspeaker setup.

X-ray diagnostic apparatus and method for operating an x-ray diagnostic apparatus for determining quality values
column13: The invention relates to an angiographic x-ray diagnostic apparatus with an x-ray radiator having an x-ray tube, with a patient positioning table having a radiation-transparent positioning plate and mattress, with an x-ray detector, with an imaging system, an image processing unit and a measuring device to which the output signals of the x-ray detector are fed and which has a first device for determining a value determining the reproduction quality of clinically relevant objects, a second device for determining local variances of the noise in a homogenous image region of different x-ray images and a device for taking the ratio of the output values of the two devices.

column12: Drive device for motor-vehicle window lifters
column13: In a drive device for motor-vehicle window lifters, consisting of a housing (1, 2), of a drive shaft (5) mounted therein and of a driving pinion (8) which engages with the window lifter and which, after a limited idle rotation, is connected non-positively to the drive shaft, there is a ratchet brake which causes no frictional forces during rotations of the actuating crank after the idle rotation has been executed. The ratchet brake consists essentially of a sleeve (14), which is mounted on the drive shaft so as to be axially displaceable and rotatable to a limited extent and is coupled to the driving pinion and which has rolling bodies (25) inserted in clamping recesses (24) in an outer circumferential surface (23) and cooperating with a conical housing wall (22). <IMAGE>

column12: ROTARY AIR CURTAIN GENERATING DEVICE USED IN A FUME PURIFICATION DEVICE, AND RANGE HOOD COMPRISING SUCH DEVICE
column13: The present invention provides a rotary air curtain generating device (1) used in a fume purification device, where the rotary air curtain generating device (1) is used to generate a rotary air curtain surrounding a fume path and/or a fume source. In this way, in one aspect, fume dissipation can be remarkably reduced due to existence of the air curtain; and in another aspect, as the air curtain is rotary, fume suction of the fume purification device can be further enhanced.

column12: METHOD FOR REDUCING THE SPEED OF AN ELECTRIC MOTOR AND ELECTRIC DRIVE
column13: A method for reducing the speed or for stopping an electric motor which can be operated with direct current, particularly a brushless direct current motor, when an error occurs in said electric motor or in electronic or mechanic units connected thereto, wherein the existence of certain error states are verified and the speed of the electric motor is reduced by controlling the electric motor in an at least intermittent manner which is adapted to the error state thus determined, taking into account the maximum charge of an electronic control unit which is connected to the electric motor.

Diodenlasergepumpter Vielmoden-Wellenleiterlaser, insbesondere Faserlaser
column13: The invention concerns a multimode waveguide laser (1, 2, 3, 5) which is characterized by the fact that the waveguide's cutoff wavelength is smaller than the smallest wavelength of the emission spectrum of the waveguide laser. Advantageously, the waveguide laser and te diode laser (6) in the wavelength range of the waveguide laser emission are optically decoupled, thus making the diode laser pumped waveguide laser specially suitable for intra-cavity spectroscopy.

column12: DISK BRAKE FOR AN AZIMUTH DRIVE OF A WIND TURBINE
column13: The invention relates to a disk brake for an azimuth drive of a horizontally rotatable nacelle of a wind turbine, comprising a brake housing, which has a mouth-shaped receptacle for a disk ring to be braked, wherein an upper brake shoe arrangement that can be moved in a reciprocating manner and/or a lower brake shoe arrangement that can be moved in an opposing reciprocating manner is associated with the receptacle, which brake shoe arrangements each have at least one friction lining carrier (6a, 6b) directed toward the receptacle, is known. The upper and/or the lower brake shoe arrangement has a plurality friction lining carriers (6a, 6b) arranged adjacent to each other, and at least one support section (10) is fixed to the housing and protrudes at least in some sections between two adjacent friction lining carriers.

column13: A method for maintaining at least one data connection to a terminal during a changeover from a first communication access network to at least one second communication access network, comprising at least two private user identities and at least two IP addresses are allocated to the terminal in order to form a public user identity for the user of the terminal, wherein the terminal registers itself in an IP communication network in parallel per communication access network with in each case one private user identity and with the common public user identity and an IP address for the first communication access network and the at least one second communication access network.

column12: Method for braking an electromotor and electrical drive
column13: Disclosed is a method for braking or stopping an electromotor which can be operated with direct current, such as a brushless direct current motor. If there is an error in the electromotor or in the electronic or mechanical units connected to the electromotor, the presence of definite error states is verified, and the electromotor is braked, by carrying out, taking into consideration a maximum loading capacity of an electronic control unit which is connected to the electromotor, at least temporarily, a control of the electromotor which is adapted to the detected, definite error state.

column12: Polyethylene composition for producing small blow moldings, e.g. container, includes low-molecular-mass ethylene homopolymer, high-molecular-mass copolymer made from ethylene and olefin, and ultrahigh-molecular-mass ethylene copolymer
column13: A polyethylene composition comprises 45-55 wt.% low-molecular-mass ethylene homopolymer A, 20-35 wt.% high-molecular-mass copolymer B made from ethylene and from another 1-olefin having 4-8 carbon atoms, and 20-30 wt.% ultrahigh-molecular-mass ethylene copolymer C. A polyethylene composition with multimodal molecular mass distribution, which has a density of 0.955-0.96 g/cm 3> at 23[deg]C and a melt flow index (MFI) (190/5) of 0.8-1.6 dg/minute, comprises 45-55 wt.% low-molecular-mass ethylene homopolymer A, 20-35 wt.% high-molecular-mass copolymer B made from ethylene and from another 1-olefin having 4-8 carbon atoms, and 20-30 wt.% ultrahigh-molecular-mass ethylene copolymer C, wherein all of the percentage data are based on the total weight of the composition. An independent claim is also included for a method for producing a polyethylene composition, in which the monomers as polymerized in slurry at 20-120[deg]C at 0.15-1 MPa, and in the presence of a high-mileage Ziegler catalyst composed of a transition metal compound and of an organoaluminum compound, comprising conducting polymerization in three stages, where the molecular mass of the polyethylene prepared in each stage is regulated with the aid of hydrogen.

column12: ARRANGEMENT AND METHOD FOR AUTOMATICALLY TAKING SAMPLES FROM MILK COLLECTING VEHICLES AND MILKING PLANTS
column13: The invention relates to an arrangement and to a method for automatically taking samples from milk collecting installations and milking plants, comprising a transport container (3) for accommodating sample bottles (4), an identification device (5) for identifying the sample bottles, and a filling station (7) for filling the sample bottles with the aid of a filling element (8) of a sample taking device. For a simple, cost-effective, space-saving and easily manageable arrangement with individual identification of the milk samples, a transport container (3), which is used as an issuing magazine and, at the same time, as an intake magazine, is placed in the vicinity of a filling station (7) of a conveying device (10) in a manner that enables it to be horizontally displaced. With the aid of a pushing device (11), a predeterminable number of empty sample bottles are pushed out in succession from the transport container and into the conveying device, are identified, filled and temporarily held in the vicinity of the conveying device. After the pushed-out sample bottles are filled, they are pushed back once again into the transport container by means of another pushing device (12).

column12: VACUUM BRAKE POWER BOOSTER, IN PARTICULAR FOR MOTOR VEHICLES
column13: A vacuum brake power booster, in particular for motor vehicles, which includes a poppet valve (12) sealing two valve seats (18, 19) and which is axially deformable within the area of a rolling fold (15) also includes an annular part which is either mounted on the outside of the rolling fold (15) in a form-fit manner or arranged inside the elastic material (24) of the poppet valve (12). This annular part prevents the rolling fold (15) from being blown up outwardly due to the pressure differential prevailing between its two sides so that it will be possible to reduce the return force and thus also the response force.

column12: Process and apparatus for improving the adhesion properties of a surface of plastic
column13: With a process and an apparatus for improving the adhesion properties of a surface of plastic, the surface of plastic is bombarded with ions of high energy (of the order of magnitude of 100 keV) in a high-vacuum. As a result, the adhesiveness of the surface of plastic is improved with respect to materials in all states of aggregation.

column12: Kraftfahrzeug-Betätigungseinheit
column13: The invention concerns a motor vehicle actuating unit in which the main cylinder (1) is provided with a two-part flange, one part of the flange taking the form of a securing plate (8) which is guided on a spherical segment-shaped bead (2) integrally formed on the main cylinder (1). The securing plate (8) clamps the main cylinder (1) against the wall (3) of a brake booster, so ensuring that, in the event of an accident, the main cylinder (1) can be deflected or collapse outwards without transmitting too great a force to the wall (3) of the brake booster.

column12: POLYETHYLENE BLOW MOLDING COMPOSITION FOR PRODUCING LARGE CONTAINERS
column13: The invention relates to a polyethylene composition with multimodal molecular mass distribution, which is particularly suitable for the blow molding of large containers with a volume in the range of from 10 to 150 dm<SUP>3 </SUP>(I). The composition has a density in the range of from 0.949 to 0.955 g/cm<SUP>3 </SUP>at 23° C. and an MFI<SUB>190/5 </SUB>in the range of from 0.1 to 0.3 dg/min. It comprises from 38 to 45% by weight of a low-molecular-mass ethylene homopolymer A, from 30 to 40% by weight of a high-molecular-mass copolymer B made from ethylene and from another 1-olefin having from 4 to 8 carbon atoms, and from 18 to 26% by weight of an ultrahigh-molecular-mass ethylene copolymer C.

Dispensing device for dental substance
column13: A dispensing device for a dental substance is provided which has an outlet for the dental substance, and a valve for opening and closing the outlet. The device is switchable between a storage mode and an operative mode. In the storage mode a cannula is locked in the device and the valve opens the outlet, and in the storage mode the cannula can be released from the device and the valve closes the outlet. The device may facilitate handling and may be relatively inexpensive.

column12: METHOD AND APPARATUS FOR ENCODING MULTI-CHANNEL HOA AUDIO SIGNAL FOR NOISE REDUCTION, AND METHOD AND APPARATUS FOR DECODING MULTI-CHANNEL HOA AUDIO SIGNAL FOR NOISE REDUCTION
column13: To provide a method and an apparatus for decoding multi-channel HOA (High Order Ambisonics) audio signals for noise reduction.SOLUTION: A method for encoding multi-channel HOA audio signals for noise reduction comprises the steps of: decorrelating (81) the channels using an inverse adaptive DSHT (Discrete Spherical Harmonics Transform), the inverse adaptive DSHT comprising a rotation operation (330) and an inverse DSHT (810), with the rotation operation rotating a spatial sampling grid of the iDSHT; perceptually encoding (82) each of the decorrelated channels; encoding rotation information (SI), the rotation information comprising parameters defining the rotation operation; and transmitting or storing the perceptually encoded audio channels and the encoded rotation information.SELECTED DRAWING: Figure 3

column12: AMPLIFICATEUR DE FORCE DE FREINAGE A DEPRESSION
column13: AMPLIFICATEUR DE FORCE DE FREINAGE A DEPRESSION COMPORTANT UNE PAROI MOBILE, QUI EST ETANCHE PAR RAPPORT AU CARTER A DEPRESSION ET CONSTITUEE PAR UN DISQUE DE DIAPHRAGME ET PAR UN DIAPHRAGME ROULANT QUI S'APPUIE EN PARTIE SUR LE DISQUE DE DIAPHRAGME, AINSI QU'UNE TIGE DE PISTON, RELIEE A UNE PEDALE DE FREIN, POUR L'ACTIONNEMENT D'UNE VALVE DE COMMANDE RELIANT UNE CHAMBRE DE L'AMPLIFICATEUR DE FORCE DE FREINAGE SOIT AVEC UNE DEPRESSION SOIT AVEC UNE DIFFERENCE DE PRESSION PLUS ELEVEE ET MUNIE D'UN PISTON DE VALVE DE COMMANDE POUVANT ETRE DEPLACE AXIALEMENT A L'INTERIEUR D'UN BOITIER DE VALVE ET AGISSANT, PAR L'INTERMEDIAIRE D'UN ELEMENT DE REACTION INTERPOSE, SUR L'EXTREMITE D'UNE TIGE, LEDIT DIAPHRAGME ROULANT S'ENGAGEANT DE FACON ETANCHE AUTOUR DU BOITIER DE VALVE ET ETANT FIXE DANS UNE RAINURE PERIPHERIQUE DU BOITIER DE VALVE PAR L'INTERMEDIAIRE D'UN BOURRELET DE BORDURE, CARACTERISE EN CE QU'UN ELEMENT DE RETENUE 35 EST DISPOSE DANS UNE CHAMBRE ANNULAIRE B DELIMITEE PAR LA SURFACE CYLINDRIQUE DU BOITIER DE VALVE DE COMMANDE 11 ET UN COL 31 DU CARTER A DEPRESSION 1, CET ELEMENT DE RETENUE PROTEGEANT LE BOURRELET DE BORDURE 38 DU DIAPHRAGME ROULANT 6 CONTRE L'EFFET DES FORCES RADIALES.

column12: Polyethylene moulding material for production of blow-moulded containers comprises low-mol. wt. ethylene homopolymer, high-mol. wt. copolymer of ethylene and 4-8C olefin, and ultrahigh-mol. wt. ethylene copolymer
column13: Polyethylene moulding material (I) with a multi-modal mol. wt. distribution, with a density of 0.956-0.958 g/cm3 at 23degreesC and an MFI 190/5 of 1.2-1.6 dg/min, comprising (A) 50-58 wt% low-mol. wt. ethylene homopolymer, (B) 18-22 wt% of a high-mol. wt. copolymer of ethylene and a 4-8C olefin and (C) 24-28 wt% ultrahigh-mol. wt. ethylene copolymer. column12: Circuit assembly for the state monitoring and logging of overvoltage protection devices or overvoltage protection systems
column13: The invention relates to a circuit assembly for the state monitoring and logging of overvoltage protection devices or overvoltage protection systems by means of pulse current monitoring, comprising at least one passive RFID transponder having an inductively coupled voltage supply, wherein in the case of an event of the overvoltage protection device or the overvoltage protection system, the RFID transponder antenna circuit is influenced, in particular interrupted, short circuited, or detuned, so that disturbance processes can be identified. According to the invention, a coil L 2 is provided on a discharge line of the overvoltage protection device or the overvoltage protection system that carries pulse currents that occur, which coil L 2 is oriented in such a way that the field caused by pulse current passes through the coil winding surface, wherein the coil L 2 is connected to at least one switching device, which is connected on the antenna circuit of the RFID transponder to the inductor L 1 there in order to influence the antenna circuit at least at times.

Sealing-solidifying agent injection system in ground or rock, e.g. two-ingredient fast-reacting agent, esp. polyurethane
column13: The borehole is sealed by a stopper. The stopper is inserted nearly as far as the hole bottom. The agent is injected through it, after which a further stopper is inserted clear of the first one and the agent is injected through it. The operation is repeated until the surrounding material has been solidified for the desired length. The ingredients are pumped via separate pipes to a union in which mixing takes place. The pipes are detachable from the stopper (3). After the first injection, the union and pipes are detached from the stopper, which remains in the borehole (1), and are extracted from it. A further stopper is then connected to the union and inserted in the borehole again for the next stage in the operation.

column12: X-RAY DIAGNOSTIC APPARATUS AND METHOD FOR OPERATING X-RAY DIAGNOSTIC APPARATUS
column13:
PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide an X-ray diagnostic apparatus which enables quality insurance based on consideration of clinical importance of a system of an angiographic X-ray diagnostic apparatus as a whole and enables thereby mutual comparison of various kinds of X-ray equipment as well as clinically important objects.

SOLUTION: An angiographic X-ray diagnostic apparatus with an X-ray radiator (3) having an X-ray tube (5), with a patient positioning table having a radiation-transparent positioning plate and mattress, with an X-ray detector (4), with an imaging system (12), an image processing unit and a measuring device (13) to which the output signals of the X-ray detector(4) are fed and which has a first device for determining a value determining the reproduction quality of clinically relevant objects, a second device for determining local variances of the noise in a homogenous image region of different X-ray images and a device for taking the ratio of the output values of the two devices.

column12: FUEL SUPPLYING SYSTEM DRIVING METHOD AND DEVICE
column13: PROBLEM TO BE SOLVED: To provide a reliable diagnostic method for a fuel supplying system. SOLUTION: In a method for feeding fuel by pumps 12, 16 and then feeding it to a combustion part by a fuel injection valve 18 to be controlled in an electric final stage, in particular in a method for operating a fuel supplying system 10 of an automotive internal combustion engine, at least one operating characteristic amount is detected, at least one reference amount R is found from the detected operating characteristic amount and at least one characteristic effect factor amount of the internal combustion engine, and an abnormality of combustion is confirmed. When at least one reference amount R satisfies a specified judging criterion, the abnormality of combustion is recorded and stored.

column12: METHOD FOR THE AUTOMATIC INSPECTION OF A WELDING SEAM BY MEANS OF HEAT FLOW THERMOGRAPHY
column13: In a method for the automatic inspection of a welding seam using heat flow thermography, a feature vector is established which represents a time course of a detected heat flow. The feature vector is used to determine, from a series of thermal images, a first characteristic thermal image, which corresponds to a minimum heat flow through an object to be examined, and a second characteristic thermal image, which corresponds to a maximum heat flow through the object, wherein a heat flow directly from an excitation source has already dissipated. A suitable thermal image is used from the series of thermal images to detect and evaluate the welding seam in relation to defects of various defect types, for each defect type, the characteristic thermal images being used as references to determine the respective suitable thermal image.

column12: POLYETHYLENE BLOW MOLDING COMPOSITION FOR PRODUCING SMALL CONTAINERS
column13: The invention relates to a polyethylene composition with multi-modal molecular mass distribution, which is particularly suitable for blow molding of small containers with a volume in the range of from 200 to 5000 cm3 (= ml). The composition has a density in the range of from 0.955 to 0.960 g/cm3 at 23 °C and an MFR190/5 in the range from 0.8 to 1.6 dg/min. It comprises from 45 to 55 % by weight of a low-molecular-mass ethylene homopolymer A, from 20 to 35 % by weight of a high-molecular-mass copolymer B made from ethylene and from another 1-olefin having from 4 to 8 carbon atoms, and from 20 to 30 % by weight of an ultrahigh-molecular-mass ethylene copolymer C.

column12: Maintenance of data connections during the changeover of a communication access network
column13: A method for maintaining at least one data connection to a terminal during a changeover from a first communication access network to at least one second communication access network, comprising at least two private user identities and at least two IP addresses are allocated to the terminal in order to form a public user identity for the user of the terminal, wherein the terminal registers itself in an IP communication network in parallel per communication access network with in each case one private user identity and with the common public user identity and an IP address for the first communication access network and the at least one second communication access network.

column12: Anordnung und Verfahren zur automatischen Probenahme an Milchsammelwagen und Melkanlagen
column13: Die Erfindung betrifft eine Anordnung und ein Verfahren zur automatischen Probenahme an Milchsammelanlagen und Melkanlagen mit einem Transportbehälter für Probenflaschen, einer Identifikationseinrichtung für die Probenflaschen und einer Befüllstation zum Befüllen der Probenflaschen mit Hilfe eines Abfüllelementes einer Probenahmeeinrichtung. DOLLAR A Für eine einfache, kostengünstige, platzsparende und leicht handhabbare Anordnung mit Einzelidentifikation der Milchproben ist ein Transportbehälter, welcher als Auslaufmagazin und gleichzeitig als Ainlaufmagazin verwendet wird, im Bereich einer Befüllstation einer Fördereinrichtung horizontal verstellbar angeordnet. Mit Hilfe einer Schiebeeinrichtung wird eine vorgebbare Anzahl leerer Probenflaschen aus dem Transportbehälter in die Fördereinrichtung nacheinander ausgeschoben, identifiziert und befüllt sowie temporär im Bereich der Fördereinrichtung aufgenommen. Nach dem Befüllen der ausgeschobenen Probenflasche werden diese mit einer weiteren Schiebeeinrichtung wieder in den Transportbehälter zurückgeschoben.

column12: PRECONCENTRATION OF SP SPENT ACID WITH NON-PURIFIED CALCINATION WASTE GASES IN A VENTURI SCRUBBER
column13: 28 The invention relates to a process for the preconcentration of the waste acid obtained in the production of titanium dioxide by the sulphate process and to the use of a device for this process. It utilizes the heat of the hot unpurified calciner exhaust gases obtained in the calcining of titanium dioxide hydrate, waste acid being fed into an acid circuit, the recirculating acid being directly contacted in a venturi scrubber with the calciner exhaust gases, and part of the recirculating acid being withdrawn from the acid circuit.. in the form of preconcentrated acid. Part of the recirculating acid is rapidly mixed with the calciner exhaust gases at the upper end of the venturi scrubber, a second portion is applied, at the same level, via a weir, onto the interior wall of the venturi scrubber and, in the venturi neck, mixed with .the calciner exhaust gases. Below the venturi scrubber, the calciner exhaust gas is separated from the acid. The acid is preconcentrated from between 20 and 24% H2SO4 to between 25 and 28% H2SO4 and the calciner exhaust gas is cooled preferably from between 250 and 400.degree.C to between 85 and 100.degree.C.

column12: Vacuum brake booster
column13: In the case of a vacuum brake booster a guide plate (34) is provided for mounting and guiding the pushrod (33) which interacts with the piston of the master cylinder flange-mounted on the booster, which guide plate is fixed on the centring tube or the clamping sleeve (35) of the timing case (2) containing the bell-shaped valve (25, 11 and 12, 11). The guide plate (34) has a central bore (4), the radially inner edge of which, in the direction facing the master cylinder, is flanged to a collar (15) and through which the shank of the pushrod (33) is led, the head (10) of the pushrod (33) on the timing case side bearing on a pressure plate (17) which is supported in a stepped bore (31) provided in the timing case (2) and which interacts with the back pressure disc (32). The bearing play between the pushrod (33) and the collar (15) is designed comparatively tight since centring in relation to the stepped bore (31) of the timing case (2) is not necessary. <IMAGE>

column13: Gas detector systems for computer tomographs consists of individual detector cells which form a ring segment-like array, the detector cells being bounded by plates, which are aligned radially to the focus, between continuous side parts. For accurately aligning the plates, the carrying side parts have previously been correspondingly slotted. According to the invention, the side parts (11) are constructed to be smooth without slottings and are provided with a layer (12) of curable adhesive and the individual detector plates (14, 15) are fixed in location by the layer (12) of the adhesive. During the manufacturing process thereof, it is essential that the detector plates (14, 15) are first placed side by side by alternating nesting with wedges of appropriate geometry and are accurately aligned and then the plate/wedge packet is joined to the side parts (11). For this purpose, the associated manufacturing device essentially consists of a separate nesting station (31) for nesting the detector plates (14, 15) and a bonding station (32) for preparing the side parts (11), which is followed by a subsequent assembly station (33) for joining the detector plates (14, 15) to the side parts (11) and a welding station (34) for providing the voltage-conducting plates (15) with contacts. The stations (31-34) can be integrated into a flexible manufacturing cell. <IMAGE>

column12: Polyethylene composition for producing L-ring drums
Method for operating an x-ray diagnostic apparatus for determining quality values
column13: A method for checking an x-ray diagnostic apparatus is provided. Fluoroscopic series of x-ray images of a technical phantom are digitally acquired and stored. Difference between a dynamic image and a background image is calculated. A measuring field is predicted. Priori information about the shape of a clinically relevant object is determined. Hough transformation on a gray value image corresponding to the difference is applied. Contrast of the object from the Hough-transformed gray value image is determined. A square of the determined contrast is calculated. A noise variance is calculated by determining a sum of a noise variance of a homogenous image region and a variance of the background image. A contrast-to-noise ratio of the determined contrast and the calculated noise variance is determined. A square of the contrast-to-noise ratio is dynamically averaged. A Clinical Relevant Fluoroscopy Performance index for the x-ray diagnostic apparatus is determined.

column12: VEHICLE STEERING SYSTEM
column13: The invention concerns a vehicle steering system for motor vehicles, comprising a steering implement, which can be operated by the driver, and comprising an actuating unit, which is assigned to the steered vehicle wheels, is actively connected to the steering implement, and by means of which via optional additional elements, the steered vehicle wheels can be swiveled for setting a desired steering angle. Said actuating unit is a hydraulic unit comprising two hydraulic chambers, which are separated by a hydraulic piston and can be subjected to the action of the pressure of a hydraulic pressure source. The hydraulic unit can be connected via a valve unit to the hydraulic pressure source or to a pressure medium reservoir, and a steering boost can be adjusted by means of the valve unit.
